title: Cruise ship stuck in Greenland with over 200 passengers and crew onboard
description: A luxury cruise ship with more than 200 passengers and crew on board is stuck in Greenland in one of the most remote and frigid parts of the world. Authorities say all passengers, the expedition team and the crew onboard are all safe and well. NBC News’ Rehema Ellis has more details.

title: Massive flooding in Eastern Libya claims over 8,000 lives
description: The massive flooding in Eastern Libya has claimed more than 8,000 lives and the UN says an additional 10,000 people are still missing. NBC News’ Molly Hunter has more details on the search and rescue missions underway.

title: Iranian President addresses relationship with Russia
description: Lester Holt speaks with Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi in an exclusive interview about Iranian drones and the country’s military relationship with Russia.

title: Putin and Kim Jong Un meet in Russia
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin and North Korean leader Kim Jong Un met today in Russia where Putin said he hoped Russia could help advance North Korea’s space program. However, U.S. officials believe this was all a cover for a deal. NBC News’ Richard Engel has more details.

title: 'Peak oil' could be on the horizon, but new fossil fuel projects are pushing ahead
description: Demand for fossil fuels is set to peak by the end of the decade, according to a new projection from the International Energy Agency — but it might not be enough to curb the worst impacts of climate change or outpace new fossil fuel projects.

title: Non-profit brings Israeli and Palestinian girls together to tackle issues
description: The non-profit Tomorrow’s Women helps empower Israeli and Palestinian teen girls tackle tough issues and become young leaders in areas of profound conflict.

title: One moment, his daughter was blowing out birthday candles. Then 'doomsday' struck.
description: Survivors of the Moroccan earthquake huddle in tents after the powerful tremor destroyed homes and killed loved ones. Now they fear what's next.

title: Rescued American cave explorer’s fiancée speaks on his current condition
description: Jessica Van Ord, the fiancée of the rescued American cave explorer, was in the Turkish cave when Mark Dickey fell ill, but climbed out to help with the rescue efforts. Van Ord gives an update on Dickey’s current condition since the rescue.

title: Bodies wash ashore in Libya as devastated city races to count its dead after floods
description: The eastern Libya city of Derna was racing to count and bury the dead after devatstaing floods left more than 5,000 people dead and many more missing.

title: Former No. 1 tennis player Simona Halep gets 4-year ban in doping case
description: Two-time Grand Slam champion Simona Halep has been suspended from professional tennis for four years for doping violations, the International Tennis Integrity Agency said Tuesday.

title: They were celebrating a 21st birthday and then: 'Doomsday'
description: NBC News' Raf Sanchez heard how Ali was celebrating his daughter's 21st birthday when the earthquake struck Amizmiz, Morocco.

title: Floods in Libya leave nearly 6,000 dead, thousands more missing
description: A powerful storm dropped nine months of rain in just six hours in Libya. Now, thousand are dead and thousands more are missing. NBC’s Kelly Cobiella reports for TODAY.

title: Kim Jong Un, Putin tour Russia's largest rocket launch site
description: Russia’s Vladimir Putin and North Korean leader Kim Jong Un have come together for a rare face-to-face meeting at a remote rocket launch facility in Siberia. NBC’s Richard Engel reports for TODAY.

title: Video shows the heartbreaking recovery of bodies from Libya's devastating floods
description: More than 2,000 bodies of victims of the flooding in Derna have been recovered, Libyan officials said.

title: Russian warships hit in major attack on Black Sea base
description: A Ukrainian attack set the home of Russia's Black Sea Fleet ablaze on Wednesday, damaging two warships and injuring dozens of people, Russian authorities said.

title: Deadly fire claims numerous lives in Vietnam's capital
description: A fire in a nine-story apartment building in Vietnam’s capital killed at least 10 people, including four children, and injured more than 50 others, state media reported

title: Ukraine attacks shipyard in Russia-controlled Crimea with cruise missiles, Moscow says
description: A Ukrainian attack on a shipyard in Russian-controlled Crimea wounded 24 people, damaged two ships undergoing repairs and caused a fire, Russian authorities reported.

title: Aung San Suu Kyi’s son ‘extremely worried’ about his mother’s health
description: The son of Aung San Suu Kyi, Myanmar’s detained former leader, said he was “extremely worried” about his mother’s health, saying she was struggling to eat and was being refused permission to see an outside doctor.

title: Fire in a 9-story apartment building in Vietnam’s capital kills at least 10 people
description: A fire in a nine-story apartment building in Vietnam’s capital killed at least 10 people, including four children, and injured more than 50 others, state media reported Wednesday.

title: North Korea's Kim pledges 'unconditional support' for Russia at meeting with Putin
description: Russian President Vladimir Putin greeted North Korean leader Kim Jong Un at a cosmodrome in Russia's Far East on Wednesday. Kim said he backed Russia's "sacred fight to defend its sovereignty."

title: 10,000 people missing and feared dead after floods sweeps Libya
description: Up to 10,000 people are missing and feared dead after a severe storm brought a devastating surge of floodwaters across the country’s east. NBC News’ Ellison Barber has more.

title: More than 2,000 killed in Morocco earthquake as rescuers search for survivors
description: More than 2,000 people are dead after a magnitude 6.8 earthquake struck Morocco. NBC News' Matt Bradley has the latest.
